files..claude-plugin/marketplace.json:
{
  "name": "claude-marketplace",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A community marketplace for Claude Code plugins",
  "owner": {
    "name": "Claude Marketplace Team",
    "email": "marketplace@example.com"
  },
  "pluginRoot": "./plugins",
  "plugins": [
    {
      "name": "code-reviewer",
      "description": "Automated code review with best practices suggestions",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "author": "Claude Team",
      "source": "./plugins/code-reviewer",
      "keywords": ["review", "quality", "analysis"],
      "commands": true,
      "agents": true
    },
    {
      "name": "git-helper",
      "description": "Simplified git operations with natural language",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "author": "Community",
      "source": "./plugins/git-helper",
      "keywords": ["git", "version-control"],
      "commands": true
    },
    {
      "name": "test-generator",
      "description": "Generate comprehensive test cases automatically",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "author": "QA Experts",
      "source": "./plugins/test-generator",
      "keywords": ["testing", "qa", "automation"],
      "commands": true,
      "agents": true
    }
  ]
}
files.README.md:
# Claude Marketplace

A community-driven marketplace for Claude Code plugins, tools, and extensions.

## Installation

Add this marketplace to your Claude Code:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add yourusername/ClaudeMarketplace
```

Or using a direct URL:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add https://github.com/yourusername/ClaudeMarketplace
```

## Available Plugins

### Code Reviewer
Automated code review with best practices suggestions
```bash
/plugin install code-reviewer
```

### Git Helper
Simplified git operations with natural language commands
```bash
/plugin install git-helper
```

### Test Generator
Generate comprehensive test cases automatically
```bash
/plugin install test-generator
```

## Contributing

Want to add your plugin to this marketplace?

1. Fork this repository
2. Add your plugin to `plugins/` directory
3. Update `.claude-plugin/marketplace.json` with your plugin entry
4. Submit a pull request

### Plugin Entry Format

```json
{
  "name": "your-plugin-name",
  "description": "What your plugin does",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "author": "Your Name",
  "source": "./plugins/your-plugin-name",
  "keywords": ["relevant", "keywords"],
  "commands": true,
  "agents": true
}
```

## Plugin Structure

Each plugin should be in its own directory under `plugins/`:

```
plugins/your-plugin/
├── .claude/
│   └── commands/
│       └── your-command.md
├── agents/
│   └── your-agent.ts
└── README.md
```

## License

MIT
files.plugins/code-reviewer/README.md:
# Code Reviewer Plugin

Automated code review with best practices suggestions.

## Features

- Analyzes code quality
- Suggests improvements
- Checks for common issues
- Reviews architecture patterns

## Usage

```bash
/review
```

This will analyze the current file or selection and provide feedback on:
- Code style and consistency
- Potential bugs
- Performance improvements
- Best practices
files.plugins/git-helper/README.md:
# Git Helper Plugin

Simplified git operations with natural language commands.

## Features

- Easy commit message generation
- Branch management assistance
- Conflict resolution help
- Git history analysis

## Usage

```bash
/git-commit
/git-branch
/git-help
```

Makes working with git more intuitive and faster.
files.plugins/test-generator/README.md:
# Test Generator Plugin

Generate comprehensive test cases automatically.

## Features

- Unit test generation
- Integration test scaffolding
- Test coverage analysis
- Mock data generation

## Usage

```bash
/generate-tests
```

Analyzes the current function or class and generates appropriate test cases.
